    chirps: API Client for the Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station Data

    Kauê de Sousa

    Department of Agricultural Sciences, Inland Norway University of Applied Sciences, Hamar, Norway; and Bioversity International, Rome, Italy
    Overview.Rmd

    Summary

    The chirps package provides functionalities for reproducible analysis using the CHIRPS data1 in R2. CHIRPS is a tool developed by the Climate Hazards Group1 for hight resolution precipitation gridded data. Is a 35+ year quasi-global rainfall data set. Spanning 50°S-50°N (and all longitudes) and ranging from 1981 to near-present, CHIRPS incorporates 0.05° resolution satellite imagery, and in-situ station data to create gridded rainfall time series for trend analysis and seasonal drought monitoring1.

    References

    1. Funk, C., Peterson, P., Landsfeld, M. & Pedreros, D. et al. The climate hazards infrared precipitation with stations—a new environmental record for monitoring extremes. Scientific Data 2, 150066 (2015).

    2. R Core Team. R: A language and environment for statistical computing. version 3.3.3. (2017).
